medical_history.chief_complaint: Bilateral lower abdominal pain and nausea/vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 3 days prior to admission after eating a meal consisting of chowder and pizza. The bilateral lower abdominal pain has been progressively worsening, described as dull and burning. The patient started feeling nauseous on the day of admission and began vomiting after lunch. Vomited several times today. Has had recent constipation and continues to pass gas. No fever, but experienced chills today.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic Diastolic Congestive Heart Failure, Bicuspid Aortic Valve, Severe Aortic Stenosis, Ascending Aortic Aneurysm, Hypertension, Hypercholesterolemia, Alcoholic cirrhosis, History of variceal bleeding, End-stage renal failure, s/p simultaneous liver/kidney transplantation, Depression, s/p L4-5 spinal fusion, s/p Hernia Repair, left, s/p Knee Meniscal Repair.
medical_history.family_history: Father had CABG, father and paternal grandmother with leukemia, uncle with unknown liver problem.
